text: If you want a doctor than has no respect for your personal time and has an administrative staff that is even more arrogant that the physician that this is your guy.

she likes people.  i'm glad to have her in my life during this menopausal phase.  she is A+ compassionate and unpretentious.  Perfect for our small community, yet, if you look her up you will find an impressive background with an impressive father-figure.  I am sure that she is very qualified to practice and assist in any community she chooses.

All of my questions were answered. I was given the facts on my alternatives. I was asked to choose the type of procedure  (front or back entry ) for the hip replacement given the doctors recommendations which I chose
They give you a appointment.  You call the day of appointment and  they can not find it.  I will look for better front office.

After going to SEVERAL hospitals & ERs no one seemed to be able to diagnose us , we finally headed here where we were properly diagnosed with Strep & an ear infection. Thank you Dr. Cherry. She prescribed medicine & took extra time to find us the most affordable place to pick up the RX & applied coupons. Ended up choosing them for primary care.

I had a heart murmer for 30 years. All the doctors I had could never find anything wrong.  This woman is a "woman of God", she found it, and saved my life by getting me into a cardiologist the same day :)

Can't find my medical records, was sent to another specialist for testing, and Dr Mildred won't tell me what my results are workout me going into her office. But she moved her office to Tampa, so I'm told, with no paper trail. So how do I find out my test results?
Very attentive, doesn't treat you like a number and won't stop until he finds the problem regardless of the number of tests he has to order or visits you have to make
I think all of Dr. C's patients are desperately looking for him right now. I won't go to anyone else, so I hope we find him soon.

As someone that only has medicaid due to being disabled and having to go through vocational rehabilitation.. and it being secondary to my university insurance, I find their policy of no new medicaid patients to be discriminatory against disabled patients.
However, the good news is that when I find a situation like that, I know that isn't the clinic for me.

My father was a patient of Dr. Sprute's. After my father had difficulty speaking for months, we had to beg Dr. Sprute to refer him to a neurological specialist - since she didn't deem it an "emergency". Once we were able to get him to a neurologist, he was properly diagnosed with ALS. Because of her failings, he missed out on months of appropriate treatment for his illness. I find it remarkable that a medical professional didn't find it concerning that a previously well man lost speaking ability

Due to some unknown factor(s) my primary doctor is leaving this practice and I and other patients are not being notified professionally. Instead of sending letters to their patients to let us know of the changes we have to find out by calling to make an appointment.

Being someone who does not deal with change easily I found it upsetting and annoying that a practice I have come to trust would do this to valued people.

First you get shifted from him to another doctor depending on availability.  On one occasion he had the wrong patient information for me was reading another persons file  Staying with him for convenience.
Think about things like... What was most memorable? What did you like or dislike? What would you tell a friend? Would you choose this doctor again?

I've never had a doctor before, I recently graduated from college and would just go to the walk in there. No one has ever told me how to start seeing a doctor. I called trying to make an appointment and the receptionist was instantly frustrated with me. I said I would like an appointment and it didn't matter who with. She said go to the website and figure it out, did not give me the web address and that was it. Wish I could have had help figuring out how to find a doctor.

I here with my mom as we take my dad to the doctor. We had a 10:30 appointment and are still sitting and waiting at 11:55. I wish my dads health were better so we could find a more professional provider but I'm recommending to my mom we find somewhere else to go because this is ridiculous
I loved Dr. Pandora Lee, but now that she's gone, they won't even let me choose the doctor I want to see!  BOO!

Dr. Shailam is a dedicated physician who is a rare find in today's healthcare environment.
She considers the whole patient in her treatment plan and is dedicated to improving and preserving the health of her patients. She is smart, grounded, and great doctor

After getting charged $2000 for a preventative visit, I was appalled because they seemed to intentionally misinform patients as to be able to charge for various tests through blood work.  Will be finding a new doctor. Office staff was not extremely helpful either

Dr. Jason Wong is great- he is efficient, yet very personable. I went to him for a contact lens fitting and he explained the pros and cons for the different lenses out on the market and helped me choose one that works best for me. I have recommended all my friends and family to see him and will continue to go to him for all my lenswear needs.

I would highly recommend friends and family to see Dr. Felix. I'm a new patient who has relocated across country so finding a good doctor to help me with existing conditions is important to me.   I went to see Dr. Felix because he had great reviews and I haven't been let down one bit!

She is either ignorant of, or chooses not to follow, common guidelines for age/risk-appropriate testing.  My husband's cancer was discovered after he went to a more competent doctor.  Valuable time was lost.

When we moved to NRV I needed to find a doctor for my family. My husband was 55 & I was 57. We looked up doctors in the area taking new patients. He immediately stood out! Two years later we could not be more pleased. He is knowledgeable and understanding...attentive & quite accurate at diagnosing first a problem & then a solution :) . I have an anxiety disorder as well as arthritis & together we have found a perfect combination of things that help...not only medication but exercise too.

I came here to get some treatments to make me feel better about my body.  You can work out and eat right and exercise and still not see the results you want to love.  Dr. Share was so kind and patient and choose just the right treatments for me.
Dr. Breed is the 1st Dr. to spend enough time finding out what my real issues are and work toward helping me.  He cares.

Went in to make a new patient appointment this afternoon  to find the girl in the front on her phone didn't care what so ever and continued to scroll through her phone like if patients weren't in the waiting area the other gal was fairly sweet and was able to answer my questions     will be giving them a try but I hope the patient care is as good as the phone usage

Dr Brunk's office refused to fill a long-time prescription for 10 mg of Lisinopril (hi-blood pressure med) untill i made an appt, in the middle of a covid pandemic. 
Why must I be forced to choose between possible catching covid or getting my medication?
Dr. Beach is a caring through Doctor who spends time and explains things..works with patients to truly find what is wrong...
I find the Dr.s nurses and staff very helpful. Their in house lab is quick and easy to use.

As a senior patient, I did not find Dr. Bath to be of particular help to me BUT from what I observed, the 4 to 5 times I had app'ts with her, the majority of her patients were pregnant or recent mothers. She is, very, friendly and appears to relate well to her younger patients.

dr.dasher is my doctor and its like she disapeared i need her and cant find her please send me an email on how i can find her i used to see her in the davison office,she is my family dr and my saboxin dr .
Dr Juan Crespo always takes time to answer all of my questions.  He listens to me. He tries to find the simplest, cost effective solutions.
Customer (patient) is included in plan of care and Doctor Gamache listens to the customer.

Dr. Sunde is a kind, caring, and involved GP who gets to know you and cares about his patients. He is patient and listens to his patients and gives good advice and council in addition to being a find doctor.

My husband and I live Dr Blackstone. He was our family doctor for over 20 years untill we had to switch Ins. Would love to be one his patients again but need to find out if he is listed on our insurance we both trust him completely the greatest Doctor you could ever have. Stella (Rosie) and Jerry Burk
Dr.Jenn works hard on finding ways to make you better. No matter what you have, she always finds some way to treat you. She genuinely cares for you and your well being!!!

My elderly parents see Dr Ciuffo and all they do is tell me how rude he is. Not very caring. I keep encouraging them to find a new doctor but they insist there are no others around who are established.
After a stint in the hospital because of a suicide attempt she said that I should find another doctor.
If you want to visit your loved one in the grave, like my healthy 48 year old son, then choose Doctor Foley. She'll give them plenty of drugs at end of life so they can't speak of her negligence.

My husband and I have been patients at  Grayson Primary Care for over two years and have not had any issues until today.   I made an appointment for my in-law parents to see Dr. Sharma on on 7/6.   This appointment was made on 5/12 and I was contacted today 7/5 and informed that She is NOT ACCEPTING NEW PATIENTS!  This was less than 24 hours before the appointment.  I would question if Grayson Primary Care chooses new patients solely on what insurance they have and how quickly they get paid.

Dr Desai speaks to you in a manner that is compassionate and heartfelt so that it is virtually impossible to ignore his steps and guidance to improving your health. You will never feel like a number if you choose to become his patient.

Dr. Roth is the kind of doctor you write in as the prototypical family doctor. He is the embodiment of all qualities one would hope to find in a Family Physician. Dr. Roth will spend the time to understand his patients and their needs. This is a rare quality in this efficiency oriented industry.
Dr Cipolla is a doctor that fights for his patients. He finds ways to get his patients the reatments they need when their imsurance says thay dont.

Encouraged by my children to find a doctor I found a gem in Dr Emie. 
 I left the office amazed at the efficiency and professionalism the overall car ...
Careful when choosing your primary.  Martinez was the worst experience I have ever had.  Not sure how he is even able to practice, or call himself a doctor.
Plan on choosing Dr. Liang if you want to wait 2 weeks to a month to see her.

Always behind in seeing patients. The wait time in office and examine room is too long. Estrella always seems to be in a rush with her patients and does not take the time to find out if there is anything more that they might need.

After watching a YouTube Video for Dr. Erin O'Leary I was excited to choose Scripps Clinic to care for my Children. However it took me 2 days of calling and waiting on hold for over 15 minutes to even get someone on the phone and then their schedules are so limited and unaccommodating. I tried calling to reschedule due to conflict and it took another 2 days to get through so I ended up canceling and I will be moving them over to another clinic. Horrible customer service.

I have found Dr. Blum to be a very good general practitioner. Have had no problems with her in four years, but starting in 2018, she no longer participates in Medicare. Instead she will be charging fees per annum which are not exactly cheap. This leaves me with unacceptable options: opt out of Medicare b so as not to duplicate costs but then have no ready access to doctors when not at home, pay double costs for boutique services at home with coverage while away from home, find another doctor. This is disappointing to me. I did not choose to participate in social medicine, but having contributed my entire working life without the option to recoup those costs, I do not feel at liberty to simply walk out on Medicare b. Once out, you can't get back in. Not good, and I don't appreciate having this more or less forced on me when I was satisfied with the status quo ante.

I have never had to wait for an appointment and unlike other doctors I have seen in my life, Dr Frerker never makes me feel like he is rushing to get to the next patient.  His staff doesn't overbook so he actually has time to spend with his patients.  A rare find in today's hurry-up world.

Sassy Armenian women that suddenly speak nicer to you when you speak Armenian with them instead of English. Still not organized regardless of language like many reviews here. Lots of other doctors to choose from in this area.

I was a patient of Dr. Graham's when she was in Temple. I really miss the care and attention to my health that Dr. Graham gives to her patients.  I never felt rushed and she listened and cared.  I have been to several other doctors since she moved away and cannot find anyone that even comes close to the care I received from Dr. Graham.

If you have high blood pressure doc should treat it,if you have diabetes docs should treat it,if you have RA or lupus docs should treat your disease or condition or if they diagnose you they should treat your diagnosis,Well at least i thought that was the reason for going to the doctor,if i could treat myself or didnt need a doctor i wouldnt be wasting my time and day to go and could throw my money towards paying another bill instead of paying to sit in office and then not being cared for treated with compassion and dignity because iam sick,i didnt choose to be sick,it chose me.

I had my first visit with Dr Andres regarding shoulder replacement surgery. Although I had some wait time, everyone who was involved in my visit was friendly, professional, and helpful in answering all my questions. Dr Andres was very thorough in his explanation of my options, what to expect should I choose to have the surgery, and patiently addressed all of my questions and concerns. After my visit, the follow-up for surgery prep has been prompt and the best I have ever experienced. So far, I am extremely impressed with everyone at this office.
I overdid one winter shoveling snow and wrecked my arthritic knees. Dr. Harwood was great. He gave me great advice and let me choose how I wanted to proceed with my treatment.
Dr Lizarzaburu takes time to find out what the problem is and looks for the most conservative treatment.

Dr. Sage listens attentively to her patients concerns. She takes the necessary time to assure that the patient doesn't feel rushed. Dr. Sage is accessible and encourages questions from her patients. Unlike some physicians, Dr. Sage recalls previous conversations and doesn't require the patient to restate their entire health history with each office visit.
My life has turned around since becoming a patient of Dr. Darr. I'm very great full and thankful for this man choosing to become a Dr.

Personally, I prefer this Kaiser location when compared to the others. Sure, parking can be difficult to find near the building, but it's less hectic and I'm not fond of large groups of people in one area. There are never too many people here, so it's nice. It's also easier to navigate through the building.

The building is also located in a safe area with a lot of businesses and restaurants; a good thing when you get blood drawn and need to replenish.

My long-time doctor, Charlie Chu, is also one of main reasons I still choose to come here. He actually seems to care about his patient's health and well-being as he wasn't too pleased of my smoking relapse.

The only reason I'm not giving this location 5 stars is because of a rude receptionist in the labs. She needs to work on her people skills.

I've never written a review before but I've been moved to write now. I've been seeing Randolph Betts and his daughter Jennifer for quite some time now and over the years they've come to feel like family. So much so that when I became 65 and had to choose a new medical plan I picked mine based on the fact that I could remain their patient. I've a myriad of medical problems and always received the care or referrals needed. Sue Boss
Dr. Mackay is a great choice for a family doctor in the Castle Rock area.  She is a very caring and compassionate doctor which is sometimes hard to find.

Poor communication. Office is unorganized. The wrong EKG paperwork for my 1st Class Med was sent to the FAA. Now I have to spend more money on appointments (at a different doctor of course) to resolve the issue. If able, I recommend choosing a different AME for your FAA medical!

So very sadden that we can not have you as our doctor,even worse that my son can not. The new doctor does not see patients under 18. This is Heartbreaking. He has been with you since he was 2 and now just turning 17 its so unfair. I hope we can find where you end up at.
Dr Raina knows how treat patients in the best way she is very knowledgeable and professional. As a human being you will find one of the best!

There are choices you the patient has made, either good or bad that have brought you to this office.  Dr. Williams listens very closely, in detail, then evaluates those reasons before advising a path to follow. This is called three-dimensional thinking.  It is rear to find it and even stranger to find it practiced with such professionalism.  Dr. Jared Williams is truly at the top of his game.
Dr. Marshall took his time in reviewing my records and in helping me find additional specialists in the area.

Dr. Adams for over a year only had 2 answers for me: "painkillers and antibiotics", she was quick at prescribing very potent painkillers and antibiotics, but did not put enough effort into trying to find the reason behind the symptoms. Unreasonably strong medicines without understanding what was actually the problem! Just a quick " migraine " as a diagnosis and a "brain-tumor-level of a painkiller"?! No, thanks! I'll find a doctor who wants me healthy, not doped!
My whole family goes to see Caskey. We all love him! He takes his time and explains everything. Treats everyone like a person which is hard to find with doctors.

Dr. Delaune is an amazing doctor who takes the time to listen to his patients to find the right diagnosis and the right treatment for whatever ails them. He has been my Primary Care doctor for years, and I trust him implicitly.

Dr. Sills is a rare find. Her office is unassuming because her and her staff's competence eliminates the need for all the bells and whistles used by other doctors. They all listen and pay attention. She is the best medical detective I've ever met. When you need a real doctor, go to Dr. Sills. With my first visit, she outdid an Emory pretend-doctor by a longshot. My only problem is that I did not find her soon enough.
Listening to patient, evaluating, addressing patients concerns, and finding the most practical and cost effective resolution!! Kudos!!

Find another Doctor- This office is terrible. She doesn't want to talk about more than one issue at a time, and once I had an appointment at 8 am and literally had me sitting here waiting in a johnnie for almost an hour. I choose to put my clothes on and walk out. I have work and didn't have that type of time to waste. While she was in the Plainville office she miss diagnosed me and 6 mths later what she called age spots turned out to be cancers and I had to have them removed.

A patient of over 10+ years. Lately, the care has been uncompassionate and uncaring. In the process of finding a new P
CP.

Had a great experience today with my visit to Dr. Drost. I had a bad Hemorrhoid that turned into a blood clot. He knew exactly what to do and he took care of it. This was the first one i have ever had. I think one thing people have to understand is that this is one of the most severe types of pain you will experience and treating it will hurt no matter what type of treatment you choose its the nature of this health problem. The bottom line is finding someone who knows what there doing is the most important thing you can do and this Doctor knows his stuff. So grin and bare it and let him fix it and you will be glad you did. I suffered for a week and a half in sheer misery before I went to see him and i learned had i seen him within in the first 48 Hours of the onset he could have cut the recovery time down considerably. So don't waste a minute call the minute it hits. This guy made me feel comfortable and i would recommend him to anyone.

No help from the doctor I've been seeing regularly. Rather than try and help me determine my issues and where my results are coming from she just accepts them and says she can't help me. My doctor who is supposed to care is forcing me to now try and actually find medication on the street which I've never done before (aside from what my test says which has been tampered with if even by someone I know) and now have to find illegal sources. 👍 excellent patient care. Especially after being an ongoing patient. Would not recommend her or the facility.
Very difficult to get an appointment. My daughter was sick and we were told to go to Urgent Care center because they were too busy. This happened twice. We wI'll find another doctor to see
When a patient goes to a doctor, they need to be able to feel comfortable enough to ask questions, and be able to discuss their concerns with their do ...

My wife and I have been seeing Julie for years. She found two medical situations that needed to be taken care of in that time ( 1 cancer ) and handled both in a professional manner. We had to choose health insurers last year and stayed with Kelsey partially y because of Julies care
Best Dr I have had in years but he suddenly left his last practice location and I do not know how to find his new location

Dr. Scott is a gifted and caring doctor.  I had seen other doctors multiple times and they were unable or unwilling to test and look into the causes of my anxiety, depression, and stomach discomfort I had been experiencing after moving overseas.  I knew I was not myself but could not find answers.  Doctor Scott was extremely knowledgeable and thoroughly reviewed my lab work.  He helped me find a path to recovery and I love that he is a resource even though I am outside of the US again.

Love Dr. Gannon and her nurse Christy! I highly recommend choosing them to take care of your medical needs.  They make you feel at ease and actually listen to what concerns you might have. Never a wait and if you email you get a quick response. No they don't take insurance but the doctors who do , don't listen and make you wait for hours sometimes.  I decided you get what you pay for and if I have to pay to get good quality care it is worth it to me !

Receiptionist ignored me initially. No big deal, maybe she was just having a bad day. I have seen Dr. Martin a couple of times, and have tolerated her bluntness because she seemed to be a good physician, and I still believe that she is. Today she took it to another level, and I will never go back. Her poor bedside manor is shockingly disrespectful and out of line! Thankfully for myself and others, there are plenty of good Doctors in St. Mary's to choose from!

If you are looking for a change or perhaps new to the area, Dr. Calley is conveniently located off the North Dallas Tollway one block to the West. He has a professional and courteous staff that is there to assist in your needs. He takes his time with you and does not rush you through your diagnosis or treatment plan, A comfortable atmosphere in a big city with lots of choices, I choose Dr. Calley.

I can't say anything about the actual quality of doctors, but for me one of the most important thing in a doctor is actual being available for when i get sick or have a problem. I have been calling their office all week to try to set up an appointment and keep getting the voicemail no matter what time of day i call.. Now to me that's a red flag for choosing a family doctor. I have been to some very busy doctors with a ton of patients, but answering the phones is a form or respect for your patients...

Dr Tint has been my Primary Care physician for several years and having an established relationship is one of the key elements of my choosing to go to Dr. Tint. I am comfortable with her and she knows my medical history. Dr. Tint is easy to get a hold off. I can send her a message on MyChart and she responds fairly quickly. This last visit happened because I had a minor concern but Dr Tint made it a point to squeeze me in for a visit. Because I was overdue for my annual physical she was able to squeeze that in too. I have my annual series of tests scheduled within the next few weeks and all because of Dr.Tint's proactive approach!

I needed a referal, sent me to a quack of a pain specialist. Now I need a referal to a real Dr and it has been 2 1/2 weeks and no referal. The office staff keeps telling me they have to find my chart. Over 2 weeks to find a simple CHART!

I am an ICU nurse. I met Dr Musial while caring for patients. She is very knowledgeable and really cares for her patients. She is energetic and takes the time to find out about your health status. She focuses on all of your lab work and history. In addition to conventional treatment, she put me on a regimen of vitamins (which showed up as low in my lab vallues) and I lost 30 pounds without alot of effort.
It took me a few years to find a doctor I was compatible with, in comparison to other doctors in the area, she is great!

I am a very new patient  for Dr. Ryan.  I came to see her because I  had pains in my head.  She had me take blood test and an MRi to cover all the possibilities.  I found her to be efficient, knowledgeable and understanding.  She  had her nurse call  me at home to check my symptoms  and then Dr. Ryan did a follow-up call. This was a very new experience for me.  
Not that I  want to have to go to the doctor, but if necessary, I think I would definitely  choose Dr. Ryan for the task of taking of me.
Dr Moses is very efficient and caring. He will listen and take into consideration what your thoughts are before giving his. I think he choose the right profession!
Very up to date and current on the latest medical studies and findings.  Friendly and helpful.

The services that I receive from Dr. Fan is excellent.  I was properly informed about my vaccine as well as general health. I would have no qualms in recommending her to my immediate family and friends. As a matter of fact, many of my clients that I've helped enrolled in health plan who happened to have her as their PCP, were very specific about choosing a plan that she is in network with.  They all have great things to say about her.

On March 5, 2019 was my first visit with Dr. Couture.I was very impress with his mannerism and concern about my health. I believe this year I finally made the wisest choice in choosing the right doctor.

Langer family medicine does not care about it patients. After being informed I was charged $25 to my account I was told I need to find a new Doctor and I couldn't schedule an appointment. They wouldn't accept my payment or apology. Meanwhile I'm in desperate need of care. Dr. Malone has all my records and knew me. With a Complete disregard for my feelings they wouldn't let me discuss options at all.

When my family moved to Idaho Falls 2 years ago, we just randomly picked a doctor on our health insurance. From the first time we saw Dr Payne, he had been great. We have had a couple of times that we needed same day appointments and he was full. He has been kind enough to fitting us in, even though there wasn't an appointment available. He has been a good fit for my family and our needs.
Great Doctors and a friendly staff. Never have to wait too long to be seen and they are very thorough. Dr. D'Orazio provides excellent care and works with you to find a positive outcome.

My mother saw another local Dr for almost 20 years.  My mother suffers from anxiety and needs both hips replaced.  She fears falling so she started to cancel appointments because of panic attacks at the thought of leaving the house.  That former Dr dumped my mother as a patient leaving her in limbo to find someone who would continue her home care.  Without ever knowing my mom, Dr Furlong, did a house call to make sure my mom was ok and continued her home care.

Dr. Greenblatt is an exceptional physician. She is very knowledgeable and thorough in her assessment. She actively listens to her patients and is very personable. These qualities are hard to find these days among the vast healthcare system. She is a great asset to the Spring community!

Dr. Taube is very talkative and seems to talk more than she listens. I think it's important for a doctor to listen carefully to a patient.  I did not find her very helpful due to her cutting me off whenever I tried to talk.
He talks about himself more than about my medical issues.  Always late, forgets prescriptions, then ASKS you to pay your bill on the way out.  I'll be on the way out as soon as I find another doctor.

My Family Physian died after 25 year of serving my family. I went from Doctor to Doctor to find someone I trusted with mine and my family's life, then I was lucky enough to find Dr. Tailbleson . He really does care and get to know you but more important he is persistent in finding out what's wrong with you. Finding a doctor is a very personal decision so he might not be for you but I promise you he does care for his patients and if you express your needs he is there for you.

so far  he was nice person say hi and smile to me some how he sound alike change his way  i have no problem with him since  he seem change something  he sound alike listen to one person because of  he say do not conformation with me  i am deaf  he was sound alike two face  i already talk with my lawyer about it   other ex doctor same thing happen  i decide not want to   man of doctor no more i decide choose only of nice and sweet  woman for doctor because of woman of doctor and I have no problem long time

They suck. Dr Franklin thinks doctors only choose who they want as a patient and the patients have no choice. Horrible doctor never felt more disrespected by a doctor in my whole life. Average rich man. Don't even deserve a star at all.

All you can say is only one word excellent!!
You will not be sooty if you choose Dr. Story

Dr. Earp is very easy to talk to. He is caring and sensitive in a professional manner. He accurately pinpoints the source of medical issues for which he gives a great breadth of professional advice and options, yet allows the patient to choose how to proceed, without pressure. It is important to Dr. Earp to make his patients feel like his equals, and more so, as though he is their servant.

Normally when you first meet a doctor, they would introduce themselves.  I was told that I did something wrong because of a question I had asked about getting a referral.  I was told that "I only like to see my patient's once every six months, so tell me what prescriptions you need now", then got my paperwork for my blood work wrong (and got upset with me again).  Now, I am patiently waiting for a referral and confirmation that my PCP has been changed.

Even id you have to wait to see Dr. Ferguson it is worth it.  He takes time to really listen and help you. I have at least 2 College Park locations closer to me but I choose to drive to continue seeing Dr Ferguson.
A knowledgable and caring doctor.  Helps research extradinary symptoms and illnesses. Very receptive. Allows you to become a full partner in your health care.

I never became a patient. Let me explain why. I called and the woman who answered said she was not sure if he was accepting new patients but to give her my info and she would call back. She went through name, etc but I refused to give her my social security number. I told her I would give her my Humana Insurance number but not SS number. When she insisted I told her I would have to find another doctor. "Fine," she said and hung up. In my experience employees get their cues from the top.

As an established patient of Dr. Levoir's, I do not have difficulty getting an appointment to see her.  She is very caring, listens to everything you say and asks all the right questions.  I find her to be thorough, getting to the bottom of any physical complaints I bring to her.
Dr. Bonaroti is a kind and patient PCP.  She truly listens and is very knowledgeable.   If you are afraid of going to the doctor, choose Dr. Bonaroti.   She will ease your fears.

What happened to this place? Does Dr. Bardisa even see patients anymore? I miss Alex and the rest of the team. I was going to Bardisa medical clinic for over 10years and made the decision to switch providers last year. In 2019 an important marker was overlooked during my husband's annual checkup - Our new PCP caught this and he is now going through extensive testing as the number have drastically gone up since then (mind you, they were high in 2019). Please choose another office that actually cares about your health and not just focused on weight-loss and Botox.

I went for severe pain in my back. The next day I start getting calls for appointments for an eye exam, a mammogram, a chest x-ray and a colonoscope. I had no knowledge of these appointment and what do these other doctors have to do with the pain in my back?  Needless to say I will be finding another doctor.
Too busy, trying to fit in as many patients as possible, superficial examinations, cannot fully explore patient medical complaints to achieve a full diagnosis.

I have been a patient of Dr. O'Malley for over 20 years.  My husband started going to him because of me.  He has been my kid's doctor as well.  We all agree that we were lucky to have him as a doctor.  I heard about the Randall Road and wish they would open up.  My Mom goes to him as well.  
She needs help and the ones that took over we do not care for.  He is our doctor and we want him back.  Please find us Doctor O'Malley!!!

I caution anyone who is on a fixed income NOT to see this doctor. My insurance changed beginning of 2017 and with that change I had limited doctors to choose from and I picked  the WRONG doctor. Iris Daniels md does NOT care about you the patient only about herself. I asked repeatedly for my blood pressure script to be written for 3 months so it would save me money, I even had CVS call on my behalf. Over a week of trying I finally got 2 months but that won't help me while I'm vacationing.

Absolutely choose another doctor.I had nearly debilitating joint pain.  His answer - Cortisone shots, every few months.  Are you kidding?!  That's not very healthy. Not happy with one medical, i guess it really depends on the provider that you choose but for the most part what I've realized is that most doctors seems pretty green and just starting out their career.  I had two negative experiences in a row by now and I've decided to cancel my membership and don't take any more gambles with my health.  Switched to a more established provider.

Dr Crotty is always pleasant and thorough.  My appointments aren't rushed.  My referrals are appropriate.  It's clear to me he's there to help and guide my care but it's my choice whether or not to follow his suggestions.  He will treat me whatever I choose.

I am 74 so have my share of medical problems and in my lifetime, have never had a doctor that is so thorough, considerate and professional, as Megan Malzone, M.D. I did read some negative reviews regarding getting an appointment, but don't understand why they are single out the doctor. She is a doctor and does not own or run the practice. If you have a problem with scheduling then complain to the medical group. I don't think you would find a more conscientious or skilled doctor in this county.
Dr. Jenkins helps me understand the problem. He doesn't just quickly prescribe a medication, but helps me choose the best route.

Dr. Allen used to be my doctor at another clinic and he saved my son's life by accurately diagnosing a burst appendix.

Things have changed. He no longer sees patients directly and has his Physician Assistants see you instead. He only sees patients if they're cash-paying (i.e., no insurance). 

So what's the point of having a good doctor who won't even see you? Absolutely none.

Many people like Dr. Cook.  If all you need is the most basic care, he'll do. You can get an appointment quickly, you won't have to wait long, and he'll write you a prescription and get you on your way.

If you want a caring doctor who will spend the time to listen to you, then ask questions about your condition to be sure to get the right diagnosis, then Dr. Cook is not for you.

I've learned the hard way that good doctors are very hard to find. When you do find one, they're booked. That's just how it seems to work.
Dr. Awad is a very caring doctor and takes her time with me to find out what is wrong.

I asked her who she was and why she was there and she told me that she was concerned about what I had been through because I was so young, 47. How may doctors care enough to check on a stranger?!!!

well experienced and very caring doctor and staff members. I definitely recommend people including Japanese speaking patients.

Dr. Pfeffer was kind, patient, & helpful to my mother. Several of her doctor's will not "see" her, physically, due to COVID-19. Everyone is asking her to do TeleHealth. After my original Medicare provider dropped out of my plan I had to find another doctor that would accept my plan and new patients. I wish I had read the reviews first. I needed my seizure meds refilled.  I got that, nothing more.  I usually have pain meds filled every 6-9 months. He told me he wasn't going to lose his license for that.  Had to call 3 times for blood work results. He could've  cared less of my needs or listen to what I had to say. Can't wait to change plans and DOCTOR.

I visited Dr. Streete- Smalls office twice.She is very kind, caring, thorough and she listen to me, spent quality time with me. I love her and her staff.With all that's happening in Healthcare right now, patients want to feel that their concern and health issues are addressed and she does that.i have search so hard to find a good Doctor and thank God i found her by commendation from other patients.

After my primary care physician retired, I was assigned to Dr. Ming Tsang.  He was very helpful and professional during my consult.  However, I didn't receive any follow-up on my lab results for almost 8 weeks after my blood work was taken.  He did apologize but it caused a great deal of anxiety.  Furthermore, I recently contacted him for a UTI.  Not only did his nursing staff belittle me for a misunderstanding, I never received a follow-up call for treatment.  I ended up having to find another physician for an urgent call visit to provide treatment.  I believe that healthcare is not only about the physician, but the entire clinical care delivery experience.

While smart and well-informed, Dr. Oppenheim employs an archaic approach of rote formulaic flowchart administration of health care.  There is no substantive listening to the patient, and contemplation or consideration of any unique circumstances or patient insights is nonexistent.  Treatment consists simply of whatever is textbook standard protocall correct.  As such, Dr. Oppenheim is actually a good choice for those individuals who are genuinely best served by just being told what to do ... and make no mistake, there are many such patients.

In my case, however, I carefully choose all my physicians, not only for their superior levels of competence, but also for their interactive manner and their inclusion of patients as an integral component in the decision-making process.  With much disappointment, my experiences with Dr. Oppenheim have very much been missing the latter.
The details on some of the questions do not apply.  I was with Dr Sandhu at his previous employer and find him to be the best primary care doctor I have ever had.
Dr Auwinger is the best, I just love him, anytime  need him he's available and whatever I need he finds it.

Daughter moved back in with me and needed medical care.  I called Dr. Belcher's Office to make an appt.  Since we are "self-paying" patients, Dr. Belcher is no longer accepting self pays as new patients according to the receptionist.   I don't know why, but can only assume he prefers ripping off insurance companies for more money than he charges self pays.  I will be finding a new doctor for the entire family as this doc is no longer a person to be trusted for us.

I really like how easy it is for me to go visit, talk to and be seen by a doctor that I pick and choose. Logistics such as online appointment scheduling, viewing your blood tests results were really easy. It's also really nice that they allow same day appointments if doctors are available.

My appt was at 2:40, I arrived here at 2:15 and immediately checked in and within 5 minutes I was ready to be called to the back. This place is clean and absolutely organized. At the Optic dept, they have a lot of frames to choose from!! I mean a lot! It took me over 20 minutes to pick one... I ended up choosing the same frame I had just different color without realizing it until they told me. I just love them Juicy frames!

Kaiser!! 5 stars! Enough Said!!
Dr Ferber is a very conscientious and patient doctor; two qualities that are not easy to find these days. He is our family practitioner.

I have transferred from Dr. Newman's office (Who is the best doctor by far) to Dr. Diltz's office in Whitehall since 6/2020 (because I moved to Whitehall) yet I have never even met this doctor? I believe I have been going to  Dr. Harvey  for about 20 years. It's very hard to find a Doctor that you are comfortable talking to. She is  thorough in all her exams, compassionate and listens to what you say.  If you have a problem she will try to find the cause.

I have been with Dr. Elena Garcia for many years, I trust her judgment completely with my medical care. I couldn't imagine ever having to find anyone else to care for me.

Pamela Carrington is a negligent doctor with a God complex. Avoid her if you wish to be treated humanely. Though, she does pick and choose who she will be polite to. After looking for a great doctor for years I found this office. I was seen by Dr C on a few occasions and found him average. Dr listen to the patient' health concern and open to the idea of better treatment.
Love love him and his staff. Always willing to work with me and he is always trying to figure out my problems and symptoms and find a cure in any way

I have made the trip to my prior physician, it seemed that they stick me with a training doctor, and never see me.  I was tired of the run around, I need ONE doctor, and I got to experience the difference.

Dr. Sethian is a unique doctor that you can not find easily. He is knowledgeable and loves to spend time with patient and teach him about their sickness. I'm Dr. N. My spouse & I really feel we lucked out finding this Dr. He's set up his office to be as cost-effective as possible while still providing top care! Not sure why the old comments were negative, but Doctors are in high demand, and good ones in even higher demand.  Dr. Lane always takes the time to explain things but doesn't waste time.  I went to her after bad experiences with a couple of others and she has been fantastic.

I'll keep this short and sweet. I am fortunate to have access to excellent health care insurance and resources. I have been trying to schedule an appointment with his office for 4 months now.  My family are new patients but his office staff will not help. Very poor office staff not sure about the doctors can get an appointment or any answers.
Dr Wedd has been my Dr for several years. I have more trust in him than any other Drs I've been to. He treats me with respect and warmth, a combination that is difficult to find.
Dr. Wills does his best to show empathy and thorough evaluation of his patients.   I believe that he will show his obvious concern for you if you choose him to be your family doctor.

I recently relocated to Southern California and read lots of reviews before choosing my new PCP.  I read many reviews on many sights and felt good about selecting Dr. Meier. Dr. Bufford is a rare find.  She is honest and approachable.  She is down to earth and does not use "fancy doctor talk".  I hope other patients find her because she has changed the way I view the medical profession.  She really is special.

This doctor dumped me because he couldn't make enough money off me.  He actually told me that he had to drop TRICARE patients because he doesn't make enough money off us.  (Thank you, too, Obama Care).  Has little interest in patients.  Poorly managed staff if he even has one now.
You can not find another doctor like dr. Todd. She is gone and no one will tell any of her patience why or where.

Mark J Rogovin and Amanda HORRIBLE, RUDE and COMPLETELY UNPROFESSIONAL .This is such an important & personal decision as choosing a doctor, people should be warned about the behavior and treatment given by employees at this practice. Looking for new MDs can be very stressful.  I chose Dr Vendryes and he immediately made me comfortable on my first visit.  He is kind & compassionate. Dr Vendryes takes the time to ask many questions about how I feel, and although I know he is very busy, I feel like I'm his only patient when I'm there.  I also do not feel "judged" whatsoever by my sometimes poor health choices. The qualities that Dr Vendryes possesses allows me to be comfortable and honest which is very important to treatment.

Finding a Doctor like Harasti is rare indeed.  From the minute you walk in the door, you will be in a tastefully decorated office with fresh flowers and great attention to detail. I am so glad I found Dr. Harasti and I highly recommend her to anyone who is looking for a good physician.

I need someone to look me in the eye and tell me what is going on, not give me an antibiotic and say have a nice day.  I won't say what he diagnosed as my issue, but it has allowed me to lead a normal life, where before I had no idea what normal was.  I am forever indebted.  

I trust Dr. Washington.
I moved out of town, and I refuse to find myself a new doctor.I am willing to travel between 30 - 40 miles to keep him as my physician.

I nothing but gratitud for Dr. Hejri.   She is knowledgeable and thorough; always makes you feel like you are her only patient.  
Even after I changed insurance companies for my Medicare, I kept Dr. Hejri as my primary.   I will soon be leaving the L. A. area and my hope is can find and equally able and caring physician.  
You would be in very good, able and trustworthy hands!
Dr does not take time to get to know his patients and you can't understand what he is saying when talking

I was unable to get a refill on my blood pressure medication because he would not accept me as a patient.  So now I am at risk until I can find another primary care provider. Dr Shi has been our family doctor for over 20 years.  She listens to you patiently and I never feel like she is in a rush.  I and my family find her to be an excellent doctor.
Love Dr Jordan and his staff! It's rare to find a dr like him now.

L. Desmond

A very recent example of the quality of care I received involved my prescription mail order company sending the wrong prescription.  Nurse Sarah was  in constant contact with the company until this was resolved.  Her stick-to-it persistence for a month resulted in success    To me this is invaluable care.  We have and will continue to recommend Dr. B to family and friends.

I selected Dr Paulsen when my Primary Care Physician left the OMNI Group. I thought since he was also my mothers physician that would be a plus, due to similar health issues ie skin cancer. Very strange doctor... Moved to Jacksonville 3 years ago and choose him. Big mistake. Switching to a different doctor.

I was looking for a doctor that really cares about her patients and really spend time with you and listen to my needs. Dr. Barber is all that and more. So glad to have found you.

I said "Oh, the insurance website said that she is" and I was told that they have to tell the insurance that they are accepting new patients in order to be one of their providers. I said okay, thanks, and that was the end of the conversation.  Not "Hey, we have many other doctors would you like to schedule an appointment with someone else?" or anything. Totally uninterested in my business.

To top that off, it's just not true that they have to tell the insurance that they are accepting new patients. There are plenty of providers listed, Tier 1 providers, that were kind enough to inform the insurance company that they were not taking new patients. Hi , my name is Kristen .. this doctor as busy as he is , always finds the time to listen to wht I have to say or talk about never shuts you off.. I'm always in his best interest .. and yes I have other doctors but I gave him five stars

I have been seeing Dr Pratt  for 2 months and am very sad that he is leaving .  I think he is a great Dr who cares  about his patients and that's hard to find.  All in all I'm very happy with Jordan family Health .

Dr. Yeates and we arrived in Kaysville the same year.  My husband and I have been so pleased with his compassion and quality of care that our daughter and her family are now patients. He has taken on my insurance company to make sure I get the treatment I need.  In six years of being his patient the only bad I can speak is to say he is too busy now with others finding this amazing doctor.

My husband and I have been patients of Dr. Zitman for several years. It is great to find a doctor willing to talk to you until your questions are all answered without feeling rushed! 
He has a vast knowlege of Bay Area doctors if you need a referral for a specialist.  He actually took the time to find a surgeon who would accept Medicare for my surgery.  
Others have complained about waiting for him, but really, what is more important to you...a business call, or your health?  It is worth the wait!  Use the time to meditate, and get your blood pressure in control! 
We are called "patients" for a reason!
I find Mark Whitaker to be a good doctor. always listens and i've never had a problem w/ his staff.

I have been a patient of Dr. Bowersox for many years, and would not think of seeing any other doctor.  He spends as much time as needed to find out what is happening with you both medically and personally to get an overall sense of your well-being.  This may be why some have to wait a little longer in the waiting room.  To me, this is time well spent.

My husband and I loved Dr. Kaylor. We followed him through 4 or 5 moves, until he opened his own practice. We tried to schedule and urgent appointment and his office staff was incredibly rude. So much so that after 10 years we de used it was time to find another doctor.  Sure is disappointing.
Dr Sooriarachchi is very patient and listens carefully.  He works with his patients to find the best solution for their individual issues. Very professional and knowledgeable.

Wasn't so psyched about my old doctor so was very excited to change to a PPO so I could choose my new doc. I've seen Dr. Lohtia only once, but already I'm so happy with the choice.
They saw me same day without any wait as a new patient which was really nice since I was ailing due to a really bad cough/cold. Dr Lohtia was warm, friendly and very knowledgable. Their office is literally 2 minutes from my home so that's an added bonus!!

Wait time can be long but Dr Drogin takes walk-in patients if they arrive before noon. His staff will provide an estimate of the time walk-ins will be seen and will allow walk-ins to leave and be called when their appointment time nears. For a busy professional this arrangement works very well. The wait time to see Dr Drogin is due to his willingness to spend as much time with each patient as the patient needs. After years of being rushed through doctor appointments by other physicians, I find Dr Drogins willingness to patiently answer my questions refreshing and well worth any wait!
after 3 appointments and medications sent me to a specialist  only to find out he was treating me for something VERY wrong and easily diagnosed.
Great to find a real doctor, he gave me a checkup on my first visit. I wondered sometimes why some doctors have a stethoscope around their neck.

I have not had an easy time finding a good doctor in San Antonio since I moved here back in 2017. I had a subpar doctor situation before I became a new patient at Mackin's practice.
My first impression of North San Antonio Family Medicine was a good one. The woman behind the desk was friendly and the facility is clean. But then, I waited an hour and forty-five minutes to see the doctor, which was annoying, but not unheard of.
It wasn't until after I left Mackin's office that I started having problems. Disclaimer: if you need medications filled efficiently and quickly, don't become a patient of Mackin's. I won't get into the whole story because I am actually emotionally exhausted by my useless interactions with the staff who don't listen. Their electronic prescription system doesn't work and they don't do paper scrips, which screws a lot of things up when it comes to pharmacy/office communication. It took me calling countless times to get them to listen, and the last time I called, I was in tears because I felt unheard and ignored. When they did fill my scrip, it was the wrong one. Do NOT waste your time here.

I was a patient of Dr. Brateman for over 30 years.  Very unfortunately, I moved to the other side of the state, and I cannot find a doctor as caring and personable as Dr. Brateman.  In fact, I am trying to move back to the Metro Det. Area so I can have Dr. Brateman as my physician again.
I have a number of health concerns that need monitoring, and there are no other doctors here in West Michigan I can trust.i
I drive over 45 mins away for every appointment with Dr. Gammons,  because I have yet to find a Dr who can even come close to the care he gives! He truly cares about each of his patients! !

Dr. Samuel's is an extremely smart, kind doctor. Yes you have to wait well past your appt time....You know why? because she is taking care of her patients at the hospital & nursing homes. If you want great care see her, if you want quick &  mediocre care...go somewhere else.  I travel hours to see her, She also took great care of my mom who had cancer surgery in Arizona and was in constant contact with the Doctors there...that is the kind of Doctor she is, you choose.

Dr Martin Bennett is a very caring person. He listens carefully to my questions and problems and always finds a solution. He has also referred me to some great doctors when he feels a specialist is required. His staff is also excellent. They are courteous and always find time for me to see the doctor.
Dr. Jones has been a good replacement for Dr. LonI find him to be patient, caring, helpful and understanding. I would recommend Dr. Jones to anyone looking for a good family doctor.

For us patients we need a doctor who bedside manners. More Patient means more money. (Move then end, and remove them out.) Dr Padia has been my primary care physician for several years.  When she moved from Schertz to the Haussman location, I tried to find a primary care provider and I couldn't find one I trusted.  I drive across town to see her as she is the only Dr whom I feel really cares about me as a patient.  She is very knowledgeable and covers all the bases.  She answers my questions and takes her time.  I'm very satisfied with the care she provides me.
Dr. Vineyard is the best doctor there is!  She is compassionate and won't stop until she finds someone or something to help you!  I truly believe I would not be alive today without her care!

Dr. Kim was my primary care physician for two years, and I was trying to find her practice on the web when I found this site; I'm trying to get back on her patient list, wherever she is now, because she was as professional and thorough without being impersonal. She's the best doctor I've ever dealt with.
My family doctor of 30 years retired and i wasnt havent any luck finding someone i clicked with.. Dr. Patel is great and friendly and puts me at ease..

It took me 7 yrs since moving here to find a suitable Primary physician which he is. Best by far I have found. It would be considerate by the practice to let us know where he moved on to as I too am under his care.

Dr. Azelvandre, and I use that term doctor loosely is afraid to be a doctor. She has lied to me as a patient, stating she could not prescribe a certain drug, but truth being she didn't want to simply because she's afraid to prescribe medication. She's great if you want Tylenol, cough drops or Juviderm. Other than that find someone else.

Been coming to Dr. Johnson since I was a kid! Followed him throughout his moves over the last 15-20 years. I couldn't ask for a better doctor.

Came in today with a same day appointment for pink eye, he was able to get me in and out within a half hour. Not only that I've got an extremely strict attendance policy where I work and he was able to fill out all the legal documentation to ensure I don't have any problems with my company. Customer service is exceptional. Plus the nurses are cute / sweet, can't complain!

Dr. Johnson is thorough, friendly, has an awesome personality, and most important focused on fixing the problem at hand. I couldn't imagine choosing another doctor to go to.

PS. His cash visits are extremely affordable.

Worst experience of my life! This doctor was rude!! I went in with my mother to help interpret since it turns out this doctor doesn't speak Spanish..(on the blue anthem website it clearly says she speaks spanish) she spent more time advising my mother to choose a bilingual doctor! She looked very frustrated with the fact that she couldn't communicate directly with my mom. (Side note - I'm a professional interpreter for Kaiser Permanente) under the ADA act  the medical office must provide an interpreter and patients should not be treated differently for not speaking English!

It was very sad to see how this doctor was speaking to us.. No bedside manners! Very disappointed!

Dr. Maxwell is the PCP for my husband and I. He makes accuarte diagnoses but will make a referral in the right case. My husband had a herniated disc this past month and he explained where the pain was coming from, set us up to get an MRI and after reading the results referred us to an excellent spine doctor so he could get the right treatment. I can easily get an appointment if I am sick and need to be seen ASAP. The staff is mostly friendly except for a few disgruntled nurses but no one has ever been flat out rude. The wait time is sometimes more than I'd like but I know it's only because he sits and talks to each patients until ALL of their questions are answered. I know it's hard to have both short wait times and a doc that will sit with you for a while so if I had to choose I'd rather wait a bit longer

Great experience - great review - great visit!!  Whether the review is good or not, each person is responsible for their own health!  For those not quite satisfied, find a physician that will take care of your needs and health!  Most of all, take your health seriously and find whoever meets your expectation.
Ask this doctor's office if she visits patients during their hospital experience or she sends a doctor that is not affiliated with her staff to visit you.

My symptoms were dismissed as a result of my weight problem. I find his bedside manner to be lacking and wish he would wipe the spittle from the corners of his mouth. I prefer to see a doctor who will treat me like a patient, not judge me on my weight and chastise me for causing my own medical problems.
Every time I come here I wait forever but yet get rushed through my appointment. How is that possible. Time to find a new doctor.
I was a new patient. The staff was nice. The doctor was friendly, knew her stuff. She answered my questions. I have found my doctor.

Dr.Amoah has been my doctor since he started his practice in Bradenton several years ago...
I have had the most professional care of any doctor I have seen in the 44 years living in Florida.
Dr. Amoah is  very caring and gives you all the time you need to take care of your problems and concerns....He will refer you to a specialist if needed without hesitation.
I have been treated like I was important, never rushed.....I do recommend Dr. Amoah and wish all my friends and family would choose him as their doctor..
The best decision I made was choosing the right office. I love my doctor, NP, and staff.  I have a great relationship with them, it's nothing but grea ...

I have been a patient at Dayton Family Practice for over 20 years. Always been a patient of Dr. Nanda. Needless to say, myself and 3 sons were told "No". Therefore, we ALL have to find new PCP's. Only finding this out when calling for my Type 1 Diabetic son needing to be seen. I guess Dr. Nanda leaving did my family a favor. I will not recommend this practice to anyone.

I am a nurse and work around many doctors at the hospital. I chose Dr. Leavitt to be my family's doctor because I have watched him work with patients at the hospital. He is highly skilled in medicine. He really cares about his patients and takes the best care of them. I knew he would do the same with my family (and he has) and I trust him with my family's health.

Dr Baig has been my parents doctor for a few years.  My father is a retired doctor and my mom is a retired nurse so you know they are going to be picky about who they choose.  Yes, the wait time is long, but his service and knowledge is top notch.  My dad recently had surgery to remove kidney stones and he went well out of his way to make sure he had thorough treatment and a healthy recovery.

Unfortunately, he won't accept my insurance otherwise I'd see him as well.
My first visit as new patient with Doctor Boggs was Outstanding. He is very passionate about Health Care which is very important to me having a need to change and find a Doctor like Doctor Boggs.

Takes months to get an appointment with the doctor, so you wait or you see one of her assistants.  Office staff not friendly, calls not returned, and different parts of my care were not coordinated--no one knew what was going on.  Doctor is thorough and kind (thus two stars not one), but too many issues to deal with.  I will find another doctor, regrettably.
Dr Syed is very thorough and concerned about my health. She schedules my necessary screenings and has follow up visits to explain the findings.

Dr. was rushed, pushed some tests on me, never sat down, ordered a hundred more and assumed she knew everything about me.  Not happy with my visit and left with anxiety and stress about everything pushed on me.  Obviously, running up the bill was more important than finding out why I had an appt.
